name: Derwent Water and Cockshot Wood Accessible Loop, North Lakes Outdoors

ai.summary: A gentle 2.2 km loop around Derwent Water and through Cockshot Wood, offering easy lakeside scenery and a flat, accessible route suitable for families, prams, and casual walkers in the UK.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat, well-maintained paths with gravel and compact woodland trails. The majority is easy for wheelchairs and prams, but there are occasional uneven sections near the water and tree roots.
ai.safety_notes: Slip hazards when wet; weather in the UK can be changeable—bring a layer and waterproof if rain is forecast. Stay on marked paths, be mindful of other walkers and cyclists on shared sections, and supervise children near the water's edge.
recommended_gear: Phone with maps or offline access
ai.best_seasons: All year, with spring and autumn offering milder conditions and pleasant scenery; summer can be busier, and winter may bring wind and shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Derwent Water and Cockshot Wood Accessible Loop – 2.2 km Easy Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover a short, easy 2.2 km loop around Derwent Water and Cockshot Wood in the UK. Ideal for families and casual walkers seeking a gentle lakeside stroll.
seo.h1: Derwent Water and Cockshot Wood Accessible Loop – 2.2 km Easy Hike
